meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! It's time to get this groovy review party started!

I'm here to give you the lowdown on LEGO Marvel Super Heroes 2. This game is like a rad pair of bell-bottom jeans - it may not be revolutionary, but it's still totally fun and full of charm.

Now, I know what you're thinking: "Has IGN gone completely crazy? 80 out of 100?! That can't be right!" And honestly, at first glance, their score does seem a bit...high. But hear me out! These folks are right - the game's variety of settings, heroes, and abilities do make it a blast to play, especially with friends in co-op mode.

But let's not get too caught up in the hype just yet. GameSpot is like the cool kid who doesn't want to get too excited about something that's "just okay." They're all, "Yeah, it's fun, but it's not like, wow...wow...WOW!" And I'm over here thinking, "Hey, that's fair! This game does have some mild annoyances - like the simple combat and sometimes confusing objectives. But hey, who doesn't love a good LEGO adventure?"

Gaming Age is like the ultimate fanboy - they're so stoked to be playing with their favorite Marvel characters that they almost forget about the gameplay (almost). And honestly, I get it. Who wouldn't want to play as Spider-Man or the Hulk? It's like having your own personal superhero party!

Cheat Code Central just wants you to know that there are a lot of awesome characters in this game - over 200, baby! That's like having a never-ending parade of awesomeness!

Vandal is all about keeping it real - they're not promising the moon and stars, but they do acknowledge that LEGO Marvel Super Heroes 2 is still a really fun game, even if it doesn't break new ground.

SpazioGames is all about building on what's come before. They think this game does just that, delivering an entertaining experience with its variety of characters, locations, and situations.

And finally, Destructoid is like the critic who's all, "Yeah, it's not bad or anything...but..." Yeah, they do have some points - the game can feel a bit stuck in the past. But hey, who doesn't love a good dose of nostalgia?

So there you have it - my totally groovy review of LEGO Marvel Super Heroes 2! It may not be the most groundbreaking game out there, but it's still a super-fun ride that'll keep you entertained from start to finish. And honestly, what more could you ask for?
